article_title: Opposition to PPACA remains, but understanding of law has changed
article_text:
Photo: Getty Images

A new study of public opinion on the Patient Protection and Affordable Act (PPACA) suggests the landmark health law is more popular than is generally assumed.

The analysis that was published in Health Affairs is based on polling data from the first four years after the PPACA was adopted by Congress in 2010, so the only post-implementation data it includes comes from the first few months after the law went into effect at the end of 2013.

article_metadata.sailthru.author: Jack Craver
article_metadata.description: People are starting to understand Obamacare a little better.
